channel.title: Comments on: Mac OS X: Spotlight Server is Disabled

item.title: By: Adam Orth
item.dc:creator: Adam Orth
item.description: Thank you, this discussion helped me get my new backup drive formatted in Yosemite: Spotlight was keeping me from partitioning it and I ended up with a bit of a mess on my hands in Terminal. One of the key factors here for me was rebooting the computer after loading LaunchDaemon.
item.content:encoded: Thank you, this discussion helped me get my new backup drive formatted in Yosemite: Spotlight was keeping me from partitioning it and I ended up with a bit of a mess on my hands in Terminal. One of the key factors here for me was rebooting the computer after loading LaunchDaemon.

item.title: By: Don
item.dc:creator: Don
item.description:
I've never used SuperDuper and I have no theories why Spotlight was broken, but you guidance was the answer.
Thank you!
item.content:encoded:
I’ve never used SuperDuper and I have no theories why Spotlight was broken, but you guidance was the answer.

Thank you!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/11/25/mac-os-x-spotlight-server-is-disabled/#comment-4116">Thomas Beck</a>.
Using SuperDuper after an upgrade to Mavericks is what happened to me as well. Glad to know this helped someone else.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Thomas Beck.

Using SuperDuper after an upgrade to Mavericks is what happened to me as well. Glad to know this helped someone else.

item.title: By: Thomas Beck
item.dc:creator: Thomas Beck
item.description:
That fixed an issue I ran into with SuperDuper after upgrading to Mavericks. On my machine I had to reboot after loading the LaunchDaemon again.
Thanks a lot!
item.content:encoded:
That fixed an issue I ran into with SuperDuper after upgrading to Mavericks. On my machine I had to reboot after loading the LaunchDaemon again.

Thanks a lot!
